A Senator wishing to prevent a matter from coming to a vote need not engage in extended debate.One reason is that if a quorum—51 Senators, assuming no vacancies—is not present on the floor,
the opponent may instead simply take steps to trigger a live quorum call,29 and if a quorum does not respond, the Senate can only adjourn or take steps to secure the attendance of a quorum. Adjournment serves the purposes of the opponent, who is only trying to delay or prevent a final vote on the matter. As a result, if a numerical majority favoring a legislative proposal wanted an opponent to remain physically present on the Senate floor engaging in a filibuster, that majority, or most of it, would itself have to remain on or near the floor to ensure that a quorum could be established at any point required. Even if a majority of the Senate does so, moreover, opponents need not engage continuously in debate to forestall a vote on passage of a measure; they can also filibuster by offering various motions and, if sufficiently numerous, by forcing multiple rollcall votes.

A Senator wishing to prevent a matter from coming to a vote need not engage in extended debate.One reason is that if a quorum—51 Senators, assuming no vacancies—is not present on the floor,
the opponent may instead simply take steps to trigger a live quorum call,29 and if a quorum does not respond, the Senate can only adjourn or take steps to secure the attendance of a quorum. Adjournment serves the purposes of the opponent, who is only trying to delay or prevent a final vote on the matter. As a result, if a numerical majority favoring a legislative proposal wanted an opponent to remain physically present on the Senate floor engaging in a filibuster, that majority, or most of it, would itself have to remain on or near the floor to ensure that a quorum could be established at any point required. Even if a majority of the Senate does so, moreover, opponents need not engage continuously in debate to forestall a vote on passage of a measure; they can also filibuster by offering various motions and, if sufficiently numerous, by forcing multiple rollcall votes.

Senate vs House version (summary only)

1.前言
Senate: This bill directs various departments to assess whether political developments in Hong Kong justify changing Hong Kong's unique treatment under U.S. law. (Hong Kong is part of China but has a largely separate legal and economic system.)

House: This bill addresses Hong Kong's status under U.S. law and imposes sanctions on those responsible for human rights violations in Hong Kong. (Hong Kong is part of China but has a largely separate legal and economic system.)


冇咩特別

2.國務院既職責

Senate: The Department of State shall report annually to Congress as to whether Hong Kong is sufficiently autonomous from China to justify its unique treatment. The report shall address issues including (1) civil liberties in Hong Kong, and (2) how any erosion to Hong Kong's autonomy impacts areas of U.S.-Hong Kong cooperation.

House:The Department of State shall certify annually to Congress as to whether Hong Kong warrants its unique treatment under various treaties, agreements, and U.S. law. The analysis shall evaluate whether Hong Kong is upholding the rule of law and protecting rights enumerated in various documents, including (1) the agreement between the United Kingdom and China regarding Hong Kong's return to China, and (2) the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.


目測就house既詳細D, 但係Senate既係純料響人權同美國角度出發

3.制裁

Senate:The Department of Commerce shall report annually to Congress on China's efforts to use Hong Kong to evade U.S. export controls and sanctions.

House: The bill extends existing annual reporting requirements on matters of U.S. interest in Hong Kong through 2027 and expands such reports to include assessments of (1) limits to Hong Kong's autonomy, either self-imposed or due to China's actions; and (2) whether rescission of Hong Kong's special treatment would further erode Hong Kong's autonomy.


Senate冇年份期限
House有年份期限, 但係有詳細條件


4. 總統既職責

Senate: The President shall annually report to Congress on Hong Kong's enforcement of U.S. export controls, including whether items of U.S. origin have been used for mass surveillance in China and whether Hong Kong has been used to evade sanctions on North Korea or Iran.

House: If the President determines that Hong Kong has proposed or enacted legislation that puts U.S. citizens at risk of extradition to mainland China or to another country that lacks defendants' rights protections, the President shall report to Congress on (1) a strategy for protecting U.S. citizens and businesses in Hong Kong, and (2) whether Hong Kong is legally competent to administer various law enforcement agreements between Hong Kong and the United States.


Senate既其實廣義過House. House版本係保護美國人既安全同利益多D

5. 簽證

Senate: The State Department may not deny work- or student-visa applications from an otherwise qualified Hong Kong resident due to a politically motivated adverse action by the Hong Kong government against the applicant.

House: The State Department shall notify Congress if any proposed or enacted law in Hong Kong negatively impacts U.S. interests, including by putting U.S. citizens at risk of rendition to China.


明顯senate既係辣好多, house既基本上都係follow番美國人利益


6. 制裁對象

Senate:The President shall report to Congress a list of individuals responsible for committing acts that violate internationally recognized human rights in Hong Kong, including the extrajudicial rendition or torture of any person in Hong Kong. The bill bars such individuals from entering the United States and imposes sanctions on them.

House: The President shall impose property and visa-blocking sanctions on foreign persons responsible for gross human rights violations in Hong Kong.


Senate版本係詳細好多, bombarding area都大好多

派兵人道救援最實際

美國參議院啟動「熱線」機制推進參議院版本的《香港人權與民主法案》（下稱香港人權法）。倘獲參議院通過，參眾兩院其後需要啟動「和解程序」，將兩個版本香港人權法合二為一，交由總統特朗普（Donald Trump）簽署生效。不過，特朗普其實可以動用「總統否決權」（Presidential Vetoes），令香港人權法不會生效。而在此情況下，國會亦有權推翻特朗普的對香港人權法的否決。

【香港人權法】倘眾議院闖關受阻 魯比奧：我有Plan B


倘香港人權法獲通過，特朗普有甚麼選項？
（1）特朗普可在10日內（除周日以外）簽署協議，令香港人權法生效；

（2）特朗普可不簽署法案，並在10日內（除周日以外）撰寫異議書（a statement of objections），再交回國會重審；

（3）特朗普可選擇甚麼都不做，若該時並非國會的休會期，法案會在10日後就自動生效；

（4）若香港人權法送達特朗普後，國會在10日內（除周日以外）休會，而特朗普選擇甚麼都不做，此法案會自動失效，這被稱為「口袋否決」（pocket veto）。

【香港人權法】參眾兩院版本不同 「熱線」通過後並非即交特朗普

【香港人權法】特朗普對參院「熱線」推進沉默 白宮不評論會否簽署

若特朗普拒絕簽署，國會可怎樣？
國會可動議推翻特朗普的否決，倘在參眾兩院都獲得3分2的票數支持，就能推翻特朗普的否決權。特朗普必須接受國會的決定。

【香港人權法】美前駐港總領事：國會法案不一定反映白宮政策

特朗普曾經動用過多少次否決權？
特朗普上任至今動用過5次。其中有4次是參議院不夠票推翻特朗普的否決權，有一次則是眾議院不夠票。

【香港人權法】特朗普不會拒簽3大理由 中美貿易戰有協議 反而要簽香港人權與民主法案

【外媒看香港】彭博：假新聞令暴力與憤怒不斷升級 裂痕無法修補

過往有國會成功推翻否決權的例子嗎？
美國歷史上總統共行使否決權2579次，當中，有111次被推翻，約佔總數4.3%。

上一次成功推翻的是在前美國總統奧巴馬（Barack Obama）時期發生，推翻奧巴馬否決《打擊恐怖主義支持者法》（Justice Against Sponsors of Terrorism Act）。

參議院以97票贊成、1票反對，通過推翻奧巴馬的否決，眾議院亦以348票贊成、77票反對，通過推翻奧巴馬否決。

另外馬來西亞政府消息人士指，香港警方有一份黑名單，扣起部份港人的無犯罪紀錄證明書（俗稱良民證）申請，當中或涉及反送中示威者，更有名校校長及老師，因學生參與示威活動被駁回申請。本報就此向警察公共關係科再三查詢，警方並沒有回應黑名單是否屬實，但以書面回覆指，若申請人正被警方調查，或是刑事訴訟中的被告人，或是欠交罰款人士，其申請將不會進一步處理，直至有關事件結束。

公民黨黨魁兼立法會議員楊岳橋指，本身無任何拘捕或案件在審理中，而不獲發良民證的話， 根據一般程序，應該要向相關警務人員要求覆核，如果對方拒絕的話，可以以司法覆核作為另一個途徑。

有移民顧問指，申請第二家園最關鍵的是良民證，以往排期只需兩日，約一個月就可以收到良民證，現時由於申請人數眾多，單是排期，便需時逾一個月。有不願上鏡的受訪者指，曾參與示威活動，雖然早在今年年頭取得良民證，並入紙申請二家園，又打算為兩名女兒報讀當地國際學校，至今已等候了接近10個月，仍然沒有回音，未知是否與參加示威有關，或者馬拉政府審理需時，只好耐心等候。

沈旭暉：華盛頓，那些心痛香港的舊朋友們——美國參議院《香港民主與人權法案》通過前夕隨筆
- 分享自 LIHKG 討論區
https://lih.kg/exnrCS

一些美國政界前輩對《香港人權與民主法案》潑冷水，他卻懷着傳教士式熱情，協助盧比奧草擬法案所有細節。須知美國國會一向是《紙牌屋》式現實，這條法案對盧比奧而言，一無選票（他的佛羅里達州沒有多少人對香港有興趣）、二無捐獻（不像中國遊說團能給予大量利益）、三不為總統所喜，他卻視之為baby，不惜用盡一切私人關係力推法案，前後5年，最後甚至使出殺手鐧，對推延排期表決的多數黨領袖麥康奈爾（也就是剛談及在1992年對《香港政策法》減辣那位元老）攤牌逼宮，才有如今極速表決「hotline」這招。這都是很耗費社會網絡和人情牌的事，可謂all-in，要是沒有堅定信念，怎會如此？
